게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: 수다스런 말렛의 소리를 들을 수 있게 영상을 공유해줘
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: "클립 말렛"처럼 사용한 재료를 알 수 있게 적어줘.
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: 어떤 사물을 두드렸을 때 가장 마음에 드는 소리가 났는지 공유해줘.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): 무엇인가 두드리는 도구를 말렛이라고 해. 두드리는 사물에 자신의 목소리를 쓸쩍 끼워 넣는 수다스러운 말렛을 만들어보자!
*촬영/선택가이드: 수다스런 말렛의 소리를 들을 수 있게 영상을 공유해줘
준비물 팁 1: 손잡이가 될 수 있는 어떤 재료도 좋아요.
풍성한 소리를 낼 수 있도록 충분한 양을 준비해주세요.
비즈, 단추, 구슬, 클립, 곡식 낱알 등. 준비한 튜브에 넣을 수 있는 크기의 재료들이라면 어떤 것이라도 사용할 수 있어요. 재미있는 소리가 날 만한 것들을 주위에서 찾아보세요.
망사주머니, 혹은 양파망 , 얇은 천 등 거품기를 감쌀 수 있는 어떤 재료도 가능합니다.
길이, 갯수는 자유롭게 선택해주세요. 여기에서는 cm,  17개를 사용했습니다.

*액티비티 타이틀: MAKE AND PLAY MUSICAL INSTRUMENTS ON YOUR SMARTPHONE
*활동 가이드 1_설명: Search for “OctoStudio” on the App Store or Google Play Store, then download and install it.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Open OctoStudio, go to the “Explore” tab, and click on “Play a drum 🥁”.
활동 가이드 3_설명: To change the sound of the shaker, click the “Record” button on the sound block.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Record the sound of the shaker.
활동 가이드 5_설명: Select a drum sprite and record a drum sound. Try changing the drum sound.
활동 가이드 6_설명: To add sounds to play, copy a sprite, then change the shape and sound.
활동 가이드_1_팁: If you have already installed OctoStudio, you can skip that part.
활동 가이드_4_팁: Change the sound by cutting the length or adding effects until you hear something that you like.
활동 가이드 7_설명: Make a video of yourself playing the instruments that you created and share it by posting.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Share a video of yourself playing the instruments you made.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Make a title that tells us which sound you recorded and created, like "Desk Drum."
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Give a description about how to play the instruments.
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): You must install the OctoStudio app.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): Make and play your very own instrument using OctoStudio’s sound function. Creating music with everyday sounds is fun.
*촬영/선택가이드: Share a video of yourself playing the instruments you made.

*활동 가이드 1_설명: First, wash the ingredients with cold running water. Place the grapes or other ingredients in a bowl or deep plate.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Make the tower foundation in triangle, square, and other shapes using grapes and toothpicks.
활동 가이드 3_설명: Once you are used to creating a shape with grapes and toothpicks, you should start stacking the grapes high.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Now, try to stack the grapes, making sure that they don’t crumble.
활동 가이드 5_설명: Have you built a tall tower? Try to build more towers using different ingredients.
활동 가이드 6_설명: Now you can let the grape tower fall down. Eat the grapes as snack.
활동 가이드_1_팁: Make a video recording of the tower-building process.
활동 가이드_2_팁: A stronger foundation at the bottom will let you build a taller tower.
활동 가이드_3_팁: Carefully try to control the spaces between the toothpicks and grapes.
활동 가이드_4_팁: Be patient. It might not be as easy as it looks.
활동 가이드_5_팁: Take a ruler and measure how tall your grape tower is. You can write down the number and compare it with how other players did.
활동 가이드_6_팁: From the finished grape tower, take out all the toothpicks, then eat the grapes.
활동 가이드 7_설명: Make other towers using various ingredients, such as apples, cherry tomatoes, blueberries, cheese cubes, and others.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Share a photo of the tower you made or a video of you stacking the tower.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Include the ingredient and size, like "OOinch Grape Tower."
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Tell us your mistakes and how you got better at stacking the tower higher.
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): You need grapes or cherry tomatoes. You also need toothpicks.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): Not every tower has to be perfectly straight. There are buildings around the world that are different and unique. You can create one too.
*촬영/선택가이드: Share a photo of the tower you made or a video of you stacking the tower.
준비물 팁 1: If you don’t have grapes, use olives, cheese cubes, cherry tomatoes, or other fruits.

*활동 가이드 1_설명: Search for “OctoStudio” on the App Store or Google Play Store, then download and install it.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Open OctoStudio, click “Create new project,” and choose a character sprite and background.
활동 가이드 3_설명: Put the “forever“ block and “Set size to 150%” block underneath the “When click play” block.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Insert the added category’s round-shaped “variable” block into the “150%” part.
활동 가이드 5_설명: Add the “Change variable [score] by 1” block to the “When tap” block.
활동 가이드 6_설명: Add “Play sound and continue” to the “When you click on sprite” block so that the player knows the character has been clicked.
활동 가이드_1_팁: If you have already installed OctoStudio, you can skip that part.
활동 가이드_2_팁: Think of a character you want to grow and try drawing your own sprite.
활동 가이드_6_팁: Use a “glow” block or “change color” block for added style.
활동 가이드 7_설명: Insert the “set variable” block underneath the “When click play” block so that the game restarts every time you hit the play button.
활동 가이드 8_설명: Keep clicking to grow your character larger and larger.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Share a video of the clicker game you created.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Tell us the character in the clicker game, like "Growing Dinosaur."
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Are there any functions that you wish you could add to your clicker game?
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): You must install the OctoStudio app.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): Click, click! Create a clicker game making your character larger and larger.
*촬영/선택가이드: Share a video of the clicker game you created.

*활동 가이드 1_설명: Prepare two fishing lines, each 30cm long.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Tie a fishing line tightly around each arm of the minifigure.
활동 가이드 3_설명: Attach each of the fishing lines with clear tape on the inner sides of the plastic bag handles.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Try decorating the plastic bag with a permanent marker. It is going to give the parachute some flair.
활동 가이드 5_설명: Pull on the minifigure or mini Lego piece and plastic bag to make sure they are attached properly.
활동 가이드 6_설명: It is now time for the race. Wherever you are, inside or outside, choose a high position. Now let go of the mini Lego parachute and see it fly down.
활동 가이드_1_팁: If you don’t have a fishing line, use dental floss or sewing thread instead.
활동 가이드_3_팁: If you don’t have any tape, you can just tie the fishing lines to the handles of the plastic bag.
활동 가이드_6_팁: Instead of throwing the parachute, gently letting it go from a high place can increase the chances of a soft landing.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Make a video of you flying the parachute and share it.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Tell us what kind of parachute it is. For example, "A Parachute for My Favorite Character."
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Experiment with ways to have the parachute come down more slowly and share them.
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): You need a couple of plastic bags for the challenge.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): Think about how to ride the wind longer. Remember, more air resistance means your landing will be softer.
*촬영/선택가이드: Make a video of you flying the parachute and share it.
준비물 팁 1: If you don’t have a fishing line, you can use sewing thread or even dental floss.
Instead of a minifigure, you can use a small and light toy, like a Lego piece or mini doll. Maybe you can borrow one from your sibling or friend.

*활동 가이드 1_설명: Cut the mirror sheet to 3cm in width and the length of the paper towel (or stretch wrap roll) core in height. Peel the film off the cut mirror sheet, bend the sheet into a triangular tube with the mirror part on the inside, and put it inside the paper core.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Use a hole-making tool to pierce the center of a bottle lid and attach this lid on one end of the paper towel core as an eyepiece for viewing the kaleidoscope.
활동 가이드 3_설명: Using a marker pen, decorate the paper towel core as you like. Then, attach two Velcro strips, one on either side, to the upper part of the core.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Now onto making modules for the kaleidoscope. Put different particles into the transparent grab-a-prize capsules to create a variety of modules.
활동 가이드 5_설명: Using a glue gun, attach an OHP transparency film to the top of a grab-a-prize capsule and cut the film to fit the capsule's shape. Attach Velcro strips on either side as fastening tools.
활동 가이드 6_설명: Fasten the module and cylinder and look through the kaleidoscope. When you turn the kaleidoscope, you will see changing patterns as the particles move around.
활동 가이드_2_팁: A larger plastic bottle lid is easier to attach to the paper towel core.
활동 가이드_3_팁: Use the Velcro strips to fasten the module.
활동 가이드_4_팁: Be creative with what you combine into the modules, like plastic eyeballs, spangles, jelly beans, or tiny LED light bulbs.
활동 가이드_5_팁: The Velcro strips are for fastening the cylinder and module, so attach them well.
활동 가이드_6_팁: Look at how every time you turn or shake the kaleidoscope, a new pattern is created.
활동 가이드 7_설명: Add a small piece of lighting. The light reflecting on the mirror will make the images even more beautiful.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Share photos or videos showing your kaleidoscope.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Describe what you see, like "Infinite Universe."
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Tell us which materials in the kaleidoscope module made the most interesting patterns.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): A kaleidoscope is made with mirrors that reflect different patterns, which are rotated to create countless designs. Make your own kaleidoscope of endless images.
*촬영/선택가이드: Share photos or videos showing your kaleidoscope.
준비물 팁 1: You need glass marbles or similar shiny objects.
You can buy grab-a-prize capsules at stationery stores or dollar stores.
Instead of Velcro strips, you can use clear tape by making a loop with the sticky part on the outside or use double-sided tape.

*활동 가이드 1_설명: Get a long rectangle shaped paper and a drinking straw.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Fold the paper in half like a greeting card.
활동 가이드 3_설명: Make a drawing on the inside of the folded paper.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Next, draw on the outer side of the folded paper. The drawing should match the one on the inside but be slightly different so that there is movement.
활동 가이드 5_설명: Wrap the bottom part of the outer paper around a paper straw and roll it upward.
활동 가이드 6_설명: Using clear tape, attach the top part of the folded paper and the lower part of the bottom paper to the table. Then, roll the top paper up and down with the straw. A simple two-frame animation is made!
활동 가이드_1_팁: A thicker, sturdier straw is better for creating movement.
활동 가이드_3_팁: Your face, your house, anything can become an animation.
활동 가이드_4_팁: Taking the outline drawn on the inside as a reference, imagine and draw the next frame.
활동 가이드_6_팁: Holding the folded paper in place with clear tape makes it easier to move the straw quickly.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Make a video of your finished animation and share it.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Give the animation a title, like "Blink of the Eye" or "Disappearing Cookie."
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Share with us the fun parts of creating the animation and if you have other ideas that you want to work on.
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): You can use a drinking straw or round bar for the challenge.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): An animation creates natural movement by showing 24 frames in one second. But did you know that you can also create an animation with just 2 frames?
*촬영/선택가이드: Make a video of your finished animation and share it.

*활동 가이드 1_설명: Using the compass, draw a circle of 16cm in diameter on the cardboard and cut it with a boxcutter.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Take the round 16cm diameter cardboard cutout and color it with a black permanent marker.
활동 가이드 3_설명: Cut a piece of black paper 50cm wide and 10cm long. At every 3cm along the long edge of the cut paper, make a narrow perforation 0.5cm wide and 3cm long.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Use a glue gun to make a cylinder by pasting the black paper with the perforated part upward around the edges of the round cardboard that you colored with the black marker.
활동 가이드 5_설명: Get a piece of white paper 50cm wide and 5 cm long, and attach fun stickers evenly throughout.
활동 가이드 6_설명: Adjust the position of the white strip of paper with the stickers so that you can see the stickers through the perforations on the cylinder.
활동 가이드_5_팁: The stickers should not all be in a straight line but slightly up and down. This will make the visual effect more interesting.
활동 가이드 7_설명: Attach a fidget spinner under the black round plate, then keep your eye level even with the perforations as you rotate the cylinder.
활동 가이드_7_팁: With more pieces of white paper, you can make an animation series.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Make a video of your zoetrope animation and share it.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Make a title describing your zoetrope animation.
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Share with us the fun parts of creating the animation and if you have other ideas that you want to work on.
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): Get a rotating tool like a fidget spinner.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): A zoetrope is a device from before movies were invented. It creates an illusion of motion, or afterimage effects, by rotating a cylinder with image sequences. See if you can trick the eye with your own zoetrope.
*촬영/선택가이드: Make a video of your zoetrope animation and share it.

*액티비티 타이틀: TRICKING THE EYE WITH COLOR-CHANGING PAPER
*활동 가이드 1_설명: Stack two pieces of different colored paper and cut them into two long strips.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Glue the long paper strips together, each side showing a different color.
활동 가이드 3_설명: Fold the paper into six equal parts as in the demonstration.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Cut the paper down the middle, flip one piece, and tape it together. Now, make a hexagon cylinder with it.
활동 가이드 5_설명: Aim the camera at yourself and video record the changing of the colors.
활동 가이드_4_팁: The better the hexagon shape is, the better the trick of the eye will be.
활동 가이드_5_팁: Your facial expression is key! Practice making various expressions with your face.
Status Field: 눈 속이기! 색이 바뀌는 종이 만들기
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Share photos and videos of you practicing the color-changing paper magic.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Add your name to the title, like "OOO's Magic Show."
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Share some tips on how to be good at eye-tricking magic.
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): Get two types of paper with different colors.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): Let’s make a paper object that changes color when you spin it around. Your hand movement, facial expression, and finding the right angle will make all the difference.
*촬영/선택가이드: Share photos and videos of you practicing the color-changing paper magic.
준비물 팁 1: Get two pieces of paper with colors that contrast with each other.

준비 Tip 1_설명: A white piece of cloth can absorb the plant’s colors more vividly.
*활동 가이드 1_설명: First, collect tree leaves and flower petals that you want to replicate. It’s best if the leaves are thin and light colored and the flower petals are bright colored.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Spread the leaves out evenly on the cloth. The front side of each leaf should be touching the cloth.
활동 가이드 3_설명: Put an OHP transparency film over the cloth with leaves on it, then gently and slowly beat the surface with a hammer.
활동 가이드 4_설명: After beating enough times with the hammer, slowly lift the OHP transparency film and the leaf. Do you see the shape, pattern, and color on the cloth?
활동 가이드 5_설명: Now it is time to replicate flower petals. Place the petals on top of the leaf patterns on the cloth and use the hammer in the same way to add the petal patterns.
활동 가이드 6_설명: Now you have a pattern made from a plant that is like none other in the world. You can use it as wrapping cloth for a present, handkerchief, or a shade.
활동 가이드_2_팁: A white cloth is best for absorbing the colors of the plant.
활동 가이드_3_팁: If the cloth or transparency film keeps moving around when hammering, use clips or pegs to keep it in place.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Share the plants you used and the finished patterns.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Include the plant in the title, like "A Rose and Tulip Pattern."
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: What was it like to make patterns with plants?
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): You will need a plant, especially a flower, to join the fun.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): You can replicate a plant using a hammer. Make a one-of-a-kind pattern with a plant, especially a flower of your choosing.
*촬영/선택가이드: Share the plants you used and the finished patterns.

*활동 가이드 1_설명: Fill a paper cup with water and mix in paint. The thicker the solution the deeper the thread color will be.
활동 가이드 2_설명: After mixing and dissolving the paint in the water, put the thread inside to dye it. Don’t put the whole thread in, but leave the end draped over the rim of the paper cup.
활동 가이드 3_설명: Fold the paper in half and stick it between pages of a book.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Take the thread out of the colored water and place it on the paper between the book's pages. Putting the thread in a wiggly shape will make a more interesting art piece.
활동 가이드 5_설명: Close the book and push down on the cover with your hand. Then, pull the thread all the way out. Don't push too hard, or you will tear the paper.
활동 가이드 6_설명: Open up the book to see the finished art. Depending on the color of the paint and the direction in which you pull the thread, a different image is created.
활동 가이드_4_팁: Leave the tip of the thread outside of the book so that you can pull it.
활동 가이드_5_팁: Pulling the thread too quickly or too hard will cause the paper to tear.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Share a photo of the pull-and-draw art and also a video of the moment you pulling the thread.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: See if the unexpected art inspires a title.
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Can something made from a simple act also be considered an art piece? Share your thoughts on that.
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): You must have paint and a thread.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): You can create art just by pulling. Try it. You might be surprised.
*촬영/선택가이드: Share a photo of the pull-and-draw art and also a video of the moment you pulling the thread.
준비물 팁 1: If you don’t have a painting palette, use a milk carton or plastic container.
You can also make use of things at home, like paper cups, paper plates, or instant noodle bowls.

*액티비티 타이틀: BIRTHSTONE MADE WITH SWEET RED BEAN CAKE AND JELLY CANDIES
*활동 가이드 1_설명: Get sweet red bean cakes and square-shaped jelly candies from a convenience or grocery store.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Search the internet for your birthstone. What are the characteristics of your birthstone?
활동 가이드 3_설명: Take a good look at the birthstone and compare it with what you see on the materials. Think about where you should cut through.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Now, carefully cut the material on the side in a straight line to create a shiny surface.
활동 가이드 5_설명: An edible birthstone has been created! Show off your birthstone to your friends. Then, enjoy it as a snack.
활동 가이드_1_팁: It’s better to use a thicker ingredient!
활동 가이드_4_팁: Learn how to use a kitchen knife safely before using it.
활동 가이드_5_팁: Try making birthstones for your friends or family members.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Share your birthstone made out of sweet red bean cake or jelly candy.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Tell us the ingredient and the birth month, like "A Sweet Red Bean Cake Birthstone to Celebrate My August Birthday."
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Tell us how you became better at cutting the surface of a sweet red bean cake or jelly candy to create a gem-like effect.
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): Get sweet red bean cakes or jelly candies ready.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): You can make a birthstone for yourself or friends and family. Think of someone you care about and put that thought into decorating the stone.
*촬영/선택가이드: Share your birthstone made out of sweet red bean cake or jelly candy.

*활동 가이드 1_설명: Wash and trim the ingredients. You should peel the radish and brush the mushrooms with a clean dry towel.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Get a cutting board and kitchen knife and cut the ingredients. Cut them to thin pieces so that you can put a thread through them.
활동 가이드 3_설명: Decide how long you want the vegetable mobile to be. Cut the thread at twice your desired length, insert it through the eye of the needle, and then pull the thread so the lengths on both sides are the same.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Tie the ends of the thread in a knot. If the knot is too small, the vegetables may fall off, so repeat it several times.
활동 가이드 5_설명: Thread the cut vegetables. Go through a second time with the needle to make sure the vegetables do not fall out.
활동 가이드 6_설명: When you have finished threading the vegetables, cut the thread from the needle.
활동 가이드_1_팁: You can also search “dried vegetables” on the internet and use ingredients other than radish and mushrooms.
활동 가이드_2_팁: Try putting a tapestry needle through to figure out how thin you should cut the vegetable.
활동 가이드 7_설명: Tie the cut thread with a knot, then hang the mobile on a tree branch or clothes rack.
활동 가이드_7_팁: If you are using a tree branch, make loops to hang the vegetables with.
활동 가이드 8_설명: Hang the vegetable mobile on your window. It will dry within a week or two. You can wash and cut the dried vegetables to use in soups, side dishes, or as snacks.
활동 가이드_8_팁: The time it takes for the vegetables to dry can vary. So be patient and give it some time.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Share photos of your hang-n-dry vegetable mobiles.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Tell us what the mobile is made of, like "A Sweet Potato Mobile."
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Share what you plan to do with the dried vegetables. For example, you can say, "I will bake and eat them for snacks."
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): Get some vegetables to hang and dry.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): You can preserve vegetables by threading and drying them. Dried radishes and cabbages are good for making soup, and dried sweet potatoes and potatoes are delicious snacks.
*촬영/선택가이드: Share photos of your hang-n-dry vegetable mobiles.

*활동 가이드 1_설명: First, get the ingredients ready. Taking the cream cheese and jam out of the refrigerator in advance will make them easier to spread on the bread.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Think of a story for a four-cut cartoon. Do you have an interesting story to tell your family?
활동 가이드 3_설명: Scoop up some cream cheese or jam with a butter knife and draw on the sliced bread. Don’t put too much pressure on the bread or you might tear it.
활동 가이드 4_설명: How about looking inside your refrigerator for anything you can use? You could use cut pieces of fruit or vegetables to decorate the toast. You can also use your favorite snack.
활동 가이드 5_설명: Place the cut toast on a large plate or tray in the proper order. Now you have a four-cut cartoon. Click “Post” to share, then enjoy the toast as breakfast.
활동 가이드_1_팁: If you want the sliced bread to taste better, toast it beforehand.
활동 가이드_2_팁: You can make up a story in your mind or try drawing it on a piece of paper.
활동 가이드_5_팁: It would be fun if you and your friends each made one drawing to complete the cartoon.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Share the four-cut cartoon with a description.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Give a title to the cartoon, like "When You're Sad, Have an Icecream."
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Tell us the story behind the cartoon.
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): For this task, you need sliced bread, jam, and a hungry tummy.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): Give your family a nice morning surprise by drawing on a toast for a four cut toast cartoon.
*촬영/선택가이드: Share the four-cut cartoon with a description.

*활동 가이드 1_설명: Carefully take the eyeglass lenses out without breaking the frame.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Attach an eyeglass lens at the end of a paper towel core with clear tape, making sure the convex side is facing the outside.
활동 가이드 3_설명: Take another paper towel core and attach the other eyeglass lens to the end, this time with the convex facing the inside.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Bring the lens-less ends of the paper towel cores together and connect them. You have made a telescope frame.
활동 가이드 5_설명: Go outside and observe far-away objects with the finished periscope. You can adjust the length of the paper towel core frame for focus.
활동 가이드_1_팁: Be careful not to break the frame when taking the lenses out so you can put them back in and use the glasses again.
활동 가이드_5_팁: You will see everything upside down. Isn’t it cool?
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Share photos of the finished telescope and the places and things that you observed with it.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Tell us how far you can see with the telescope, like "A Telescope that Lets You See Across the Road."
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Share tips on things you can do with the telescope.
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): You need a pair of magnifying glasses.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): The Kepler telescope is made with two convex lenses, like those of magnifying glasses. Make a telescope of your own with two eyeglass lenses.
*촬영/선택가이드: Share photos of the finished telescope and the places and things that you observed with it.
준비물 팁 1: 휴지심은 두 개가 필요하고, 랩이나 키친타월에서 나온 기다란 심을 사용해야해.

*활동 가이드 1_설명: Get a 30cm long and 20cm high cardboard and two 5X5 cm acrylic mirrors ready. Draw lines on the cardboard, dividing it evenly into 5X5 cm squares.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Draw a 45-degree diagonal line on the first and third squares. The first diagonal line should be tilted 45 degrees from left to right, and the third diagonal line should be tilted from right to left.
활동 가이드 3_설명: On the opposite upper side, draw 45-degree diagonal lines in the same way. As in the picture, draw two parallelograms and right-angle triangles.
활동 가이드 4_설명: With a boxcutter, make shallow cuts for the folds.
활동 가이드 5_설명: Attach the mirrors with a glue gun so they can face each other.
활동 가이드 6_설명: Fold the cardboard to the mirror's edge and wrap paper tape around it.
활동 가이드_2_팁: To draw a 45-degree diagonal line, you should connect the opposite vertices.
활동 가이드_6_팁: Carefully cover up the nooks and crevices so that no light gets through.
활동 가이드 7_설명: Give the periscope a character and decorate it well.
활동 가이드_7_팁: Can you think of a character that represents the spirit of your periscope? Try giving it a unique name.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Share a photo showing your periscope.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Give a name to the periscope or make a title about your exploration with the periscope.
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Tell us the places you want to explore with the periscope or what the world looks like through the periscope.
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): You need an acrylic mirror and a paperboard.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): A periscope is an underwater tool for seeing what is outside the water using the refraction of light. Make a periscope of your own to see the world in a different way.
*촬영/선택가이드: Share a photo showing your periscope.
준비물 팁 1: When using a boxcutter, it is best to wear gloves for safety.

*활동 가이드 1_설명: Have a paperboard in a half A4 size ready. On the paperboard, make a drawing of yourself or a character/object you want to travel with.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Using a thick marker or felt pen, make a final outline of your drawing on the paperboard.
활동 가이드 3_설명: Cut out the drawing with scissors or a boxcutter.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Try to cut as neatly as you can.
활동 가이드 5_설명: Go outside and take photos against various backgrounds
활동 가이드 6_설명: Take multiple photos showing various backgrounds through the gap.
활동 가이드_1_팁: Don’t overthink the shape. Just draw an outline with a pencil. Once you do that, the rest of the process is much easier.
활동 가이드_3_팁: Regular scissors might not work on a paperboard, so use heavy-duty scissors or a boxcutter.
활동 가이드_4_팁: Trim the rough edges with a boxcutter to give the character a smoother finish.
활동 가이드_5_팁: If holding the camera and character board at the same time is too much, you can set up the character board on the ground and take photos.
활동 가이드_6_팁: Be sure to take many photos with lots of different backgrounds for your character.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Share photos with many different backgrounds.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: What is the name of your character? What was the theme of your trip?
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Tell us which backgrounds you were able to find. Also, share with us what you and your character talked about during the trip.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): Take your character with you on a trip. Tell them what you think is beautiful in the world and the things that you value.
*촬영/선택가이드: Share photos with many different backgrounds.
준비물 팁 1: Please use whichever is more convenient for you, between your phone and tablet.

*활동 가이드 1_설명: Roll the pop tube into a circle.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Put beads, buttons, grains, paper clips, or other small materials in the tube. The tube will make different sounds depending on the size or weight of the items inside. See which sound you like the best.
활동 가이드 3_설명: Bring the ends of the tube together and connect them by using a masking tape.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Put the finished tube around your wrist, ankle, or throat and adjust to size.
활동 가이드 5_설명: Now, try making sounds. You can make different rhythms and sounds depending on where on your body the tube is worn and how you move. Make a video recording.
활동 가이드_1_팁: Choose a color that you like.
활동 가이드_2_팁: Be careful not to let the particles fall out through the other end of the tube.
활동 가이드_3_팁: Tape all the nooks and crevices so none of the small particles fall out.
활동 가이드_4_팁: When adjusting the tube to fit your body, be careful not to get your skin stuck in the ridges.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Share the sound of the “Parasitic Noisemaker”!
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Like the “Object that Lives on the Ankle,” let me know where your object resides!
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Share your experience of walking around with a sound object. How was it?
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): You need a couple of pop tubes.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): Make a “parasitic noisemaker” that attaches to your body and makes a sound when you move. Think about where on your body would be the best place for the “parasitic noisemaker”.
*촬영/선택가이드: Share the sound of the “Parasitic Noisemaker”!
준비물 팁 1: You can buy these at stationary stores or dollar stores.
For tiny objects, you can use beads, buttons, marbles, paper clips, grains, or anything that is small enough to put in the tubes. Look for things around you that can make rattling noises.

*액티비티 타이틀: HOW LONG CAN YOU STRETCH YOUR EAR?
*활동 가이드 1_설명: Wash an empty bottle, dry it, then cut out the bottom. Use a masking tape or clear tape to cover the sharp edges.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Take the plastic or paper cup and cut out the bottom in the same way, then put a masking tape all around the edges.
활동 가이드 3_설명: Attach the bottle's mouth to one end of the spring by inserting it into the coils. Then, let the rest of the spring go through the bottle's cut-out bottom.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Attach the cutout bottom part of the cup at the other end of the spring with masking tape.
활동 가이드 5_설명: Your extended ear has been finished!
활동 가이드 6_설명: Walk around various places, paying attention to the sounds you hear through the finished extended ear. How do you like the mixture of sounds coming through the metal spring and other sounds around you?
활동 가이드_1_팁: Be careful not to hurt your hands when cutting the plastic bottle with a boxcutter. The cut edges can be very sharp, so put tape around them.
활동 가이드_3_팁: Make sure to do it slowly so the spring doesn’t break or become crooked.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Share a video of you exploring different sounds with the extended ear.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Tell us the material you used, like "An Ear Made with a Wooden Tube."
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: How did you like the sounds through the extended ear compared with your regular ear?
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): Get a couple of magic springs ready.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): Find out what you can hear by extending your ear with a magic spring. Try different types of springs and other materials like tubes.
*촬영/선택가이드: Share a video of you exploring different sounds with the extended ear.
준비물 팁 1: Here, we have used a metal magic spring that is 6.5cm in diameter. You can buy one at a dollar store or stationery store.
Something slightly larger in diameter than the spring of your choice, such as an empty bottle, a paper core of yarn, or the core of a toilet paper roll, can be used.
When using a boxcutter, it is best to wear gloves for safety.

*액티비티 썸네일.filename: 챌린지 콘텐츠 썸네일 작업-2-레이저로 물 속 탐험.mp4

*액티비티 타이틀: LOOK INSIDE THE WATER WITH A LASER
*활동 가이드 1_설명: Fill the syringe with the water you want to observe and hang the syringe pointing downward between two cups of the same height, as in the demonstration.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Make only one drop of water form at the tip of the syringe.
활동 가이드 3_설명: Turn off the light in the room. With a white wall in the background, aim the laser pointer directly at the water drop and shoot out a beam through the water onto the wall.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Watch the wiggly movements showing on the wall.
활동 가이드_1_팁: Between tap water and water from food waste, find out which contains more microorganisms.
활동 가이드_2_팁: Keep in mind that a larger, rounder water drop will let you see the microorganisms better.
활동 가이드_3_팁: It might be hard to point the laser accurately at first but keep trying and you will get the hang of it.
활동 가이드_4_팁: If the water is too dirty, the microorganisms’ shadows may not show. When this happens, add some tap water and try again.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Share videos of the microorganisms from different types of water.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Tell us where you collected the water from, like "Comparing Toilet Water with Tap Water."
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Did you see anything different between the water samples collected from other sources? Describe them to us.
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): Get a laser pointer and a safety syringe.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): Did you know you can see microorganisms in the water with a laser pointer? Use a safety syringe to collect water from around you and explore what is inside.
*촬영/선택가이드: Share videos of the microorganisms from different types of water.
준비물 팁 1: You can buy these at a stationary store or dollar store.
If you don’t have a syringe, you can take a wire and bend it to use as a water-dropping tool.

*액티비티 타이틀: MAKE DINNER WITH GROCERY STORE FLYERS
*활동 가이드 1_설명: Get one or two flyers from a grocery store or megastore, and look for what you want to have on the dinner table tonight. The money you can spend is 50,000 won. Be sure to make the best purchases within the budget.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Gather 5 items of food made up of 1) rice, 2) soup or stew, and 3) side dishes of 3 kinds by cutting them from the flyers, then spread them out so that you can see them well.
활동 가이드 3_설명: Also, cut out the price tags for the purchased items and keep them aside.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Take a pencil and draw a large table on the paperboard. Draw on the table a bowl for the rice, a deep plate for the soup or a cooking pot for the stew, and three small plates for the side dishes.
활동 가이드 5_설명: Now put the cut food and ingredients on the table using glue.
활동 가이드 6_설명: Attach the cut price tags on the bottom left corner, showing how much it cost to put this meal together. Also, write a detailed expense report.
활동 가이드_1_팁: Before cutting out a picture of a food, flip the flyer and see if there is another picture on the other side that you might want to use.
활동 가이드 7_설명: You have finished preparing dinner. Share the meal you put together and see what other players have done.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Take a photo of the entire dinner table with all of the items from the grocery store flyers and post it.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Give a name to the meal that you put together.
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Tell us which items you put on the dinner table and how much you spent on them.
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): You need some grocery store flyers.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): Challenge yourself to make dinner with cutouts of food and ingredients from grocery store flyers.
*촬영/선택가이드: Take a photo of the entire dinner table with all of the items from the grocery store flyers and post it.
준비물 팁 1: Grocery store flyers showing lots of food and ingredients are better. Flyers for small grocery stores usually have more diverse pictures of food and ingredients than for megastores.

*활동 가이드 1_설명: Idea 1: Look for something that has the right shape for scratching your back.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Idea 2: If there is nothing adequate, take different things and combine them to create something that can scratch your back.
활동 가이드 3_설명: Idea 3: Still haven’t found anything useful? Try using a fixed object instead.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Idea 4: Didn’t any of the fixed objects do the trick? Then how about making something totally new and ingenious?
활동 가이드 5_설명: If you like this method, screw the object in place for longer usage.
활동 가이드_1_팁: Look for something that is long and bent at the tip, that can scratch like a hand.
활동 가이드_2_팁: Take two or more objects and make them into something longer that bends at the tip.
활동 가이드_3_팁: Look for something to scratch your back against, like a doorknob or the corner of a desk.
활동 가이드_4_팁: Look for things to attach to a larger, heavier object at the right height for scratching your back.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Pick your best solution for an itchy back and share.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: You can give a unique name to a back-scratching tool.
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Tell us about all the tools you tried and which one worked the best.
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): Have you ever had an itchy back?
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): You are home alone when suddenly your back itches. Try to solve this problem by using the things around you!
*촬영/선택가이드: Pick your best solution for an itchy back and share.
준비물 팁 1: Anything that you can find around you can be a good tool for the mission.

*활동 가이드 1_설명: Fill 3/4 of an empty plastic bottle with water and add a few drops of your favorite watercolor.
활동 가이드 2_설명: Now shake the bottle so that everything is mixed nicely.
활동 가이드 3_설명: Fill a plastic bottle to the top with water, screw the lid on, and turn the bottle sideways. There should be only a small air bubble (1cm in diameter) at the top.
활동 가이드 4_설명: Put the finished aligner on its side and use it to check the alignment of the floor or desk.
활동 가이드 5_설명: Take a felt pen and draw about five circles (20mm in diameter) randomly on the aligner. Then, put a number from 1 to 5 next to each circle, also randomly.
활동 가이드 6_설명: Challenge yourself to take as little time as possible to get the air bubble into each of the circles, from 1 to 5.
활동 가이드_1_팁: You don’t have to add any color if you want to use clear water.
활동 가이드_2_팁: Watercolor dissolves easily in water, but if you are using acrylic paint, you should mix it with water beforehand in a paper cup.
활동 가이드_3_팁: It’s important to fill the bottle to the very top with water and screw the lid on carefully. If the air bubble is too large, add more water and if the air bubble is too small, pour a tiny bit of water out.
활동 가이드_6_팁: Put the aligner in an upright position until the timer is started.
활동 가이드 7_설명: Challenge yourself to create a game of your own. You could make a game of maze, basketball, soccer, or anything you want to try.
활동 가이드_7_팁: You can get ideas from games designed by other players and vice versa. Let’s have some real fun.
게시하기 가이드 1-영상/사진촬영 공유 가이드: Share a photo of the finished air bubble aligner or a short video of you playing the air bubble aligner game.
게시하기 가이드 2-제목 작성 가이드: Give a name to your air bubble aligner.
게시하기 가이드 3-내용 작성 가이드: Tell us the details of how your air bubble aligner was designed.
* 필수 항목 안내 문구(퓨처랩): You need a transparent plastic bottle and some paint.
* 활동 시작 발문(퓨처랩): Make an aligner with a plastic bottle and an air bubble. When you are done, you can play a game with the air bubble on the aligner.
*촬영/선택가이드: Share a photo of the finished air bubble aligner or a short video of you playing the air bubble aligner game.
준비물 팁 1: Find an empty plastic bottle with a lid.
준비물 팁 2: A plastic bottle with a smooth surface instead of a ribbed one is better for making an aligner.
